titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Eckard V. Toy Jr. Papers, 1920s-1995 RL.10160
titlestmt.author: Meghan Lyon

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-04-05 11:58:03 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Eckard Toy was an American history professor and scholar who studied the history of race, the Ku Klux Klan, and neo-Nazis in the United States, particularly in the Pacific Northwest. Collection includes Toy's research files and related materials on various extremist groups in the United States, particularly right-wing Christian extremists, the Ku Klux Klan, and Holocaust revisionists. Files are arranged by group or topic and at times include Toy's correspondence with various representatives. Notable groups include the Church of Jesus Christ Christian, various factions of the Ku Klux Klan, the German American National Political Action Committee (GANPAC), the Institute for Historical Review, and Christian Biblical America. Collection also contains Toy's research on Francis Yockey and Gordon Kahl. Materials from the IHR include two VHS tapes and one audiocassette on Holocaust revisionism.
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this finding aid: 2014-0092

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes Toy's research files and related materials on various extremist groups in the United States, particularly right-wing Christian extremists, the Ku Klux Klan, and Holocaust revisionists. Files are arranged by group or topic and at times include Toy's correspondence with various representatives. Notable groups include the Church of Jesus Christ Christian, various factions of the Ku Klux Klan, the German American National Political Action Committee (GANPAC), the Institute for Historical Review, and Christian Biblical America. Collection also contains Toy's research on Francis Yockey and Gordon Kahl. Materials from the IHR include two VHS tapes and one audiocassette on Holocaust revisionism.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: Eckard Toy was an American history professor and scholar who studied the history of race, the Ku Klux Klan, and neo-Nazis in the United States, particularly in the Pacific Northwest.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Eckard V. Toy, Jr. Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as gift in 2014.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Eckard V. Toy, Jr. Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.
